The claim is based on a single study pub: which observed a reduction in women's brain volume during pregnancy.
The sample size of the study was small: consisting of only 14 women, and it was originally designed to test differences in brain volume between healthy women and women with preeclampsia.
There have been no efforts to replicate: as a 2016 review paper did not mention any subsequent studies attempting to replicate or validate the findings.
The relevance of the study to a broader: as it focused on women with a specific condition (preeclampsia) and may not be representative of the general population.
